comments.content:
I don't know what is it, but I have a feeling that your font was a happy italic once upon a time and an evil wizard cast a spell of reverse-slant on it and made it upright.  
See below a comparison of your sample (artificially slanted) to a Times Italic, to judge yourself if this scenario makes sense:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020063619im_/http:/typophile.com/files/report-italic_6192.jpg)

Looks like something by Hagmann.

hhp

You are so right Hrant ;)  
It is **[Odile Upright Italic OT](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020063619/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/kontour_type/odile_display_pack_ot/)** by Sibylle Hagmann (2010, Kontour Type)

...and the font name confirms that my feeling was right

-----------------------------------------------  
I found it using Hrant's advice :)

Cool.

Just one thing: I don't think this qualifies as a distorted formerly-"happy" Italic, since it was designed just as it is.

hhp
